attributes.action: Allow a parent to have children supervised visits in a contact centre.
attributes.additional_details: One parent always suffers more then the other legal costs and a solicitor involvement should not be first priority from a children social worker when a supervised visit is done by a volunteer and conducted inside a council building why should a parent wait many months for solicitors in legal team to respond and a parent miss their son/ daughters first steps if a parent has contacted social services and told “no mediation is to offer the only way is to pay a solicitor” this is not fair.
attributes.background: The government need to change the children social services system after a separation or accusation occurs between parents and no harm was done to a child and no accusations were brought up against the child supervised visits at contact centres should be offered from week one of separation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about child contact arrangements in the event of relationship breakdown are a matter for the parents and courts, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.
